issues.description: The problem statement refers to REST endpoints under the path “/api/persons” (e.g. “PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents”), but both the template and solution code define and test these endpoints at “/persons” (e.g., @PutMapping("persons/{personId}/parents")). This mismatch between the documented paths and the actual mappings will confuse students when they implement and run the tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the problem statement to document the endpoints without the "/api" prefix (i.e. “/persons/...”) or add a base path of "/api" to the @RequestMapping in PersonResource (e.g. @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = ..., produces = ...)) to align code with the documentation.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to the parent‐adding endpoint as PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents, but the starter code (and solution) map requests to /persons/{personId}/parents (no “/api” prefix). This mismatch in the same conceptual REST endpoint path can confuse students when writing tests or wiring the controller.
issues.suggested_fix: Either remove the “/api” prefix in the problem statement so it matches “/persons/...”, or add a base path of “/api” in the controller’s @RequestMapping to align all descriptions, tests, and code.
